Module com.example.snakegame
Package com.example.snakeGame

Class Snake

java.lang.Object
com.example.snakeGame.GameObject
com.example.snakeGame.Snake
All Implemented Interfaces:
Movable
public class Snake extends GameObject implements Movable
This class creates the snake that is drawn on the view during the game.

  • Method Details

    • setFrameWidthHeight

      public void setFrameWidthHeight(double canvasWidth, double canvasHeight)
      set the maximum width and height of the frame the snake draws on.
      Parameters:
      canvasWidth - the width of the canvas
      canvasHeight - the height of the canvas

    • eatBody

      public boolean eatBody()
      Checks if the snack has collided with its own body.
      Returns:
      true if the snake has collided with itself, the game can end and false if otherwise.

    • outOfBounds

      public boolean outOfBounds(int level)
      Checks if the snake is out of bound
      Parameters:
      level - is the level of the game.
      Returns:
      true if the snake is out of bounds, the game can end and false if otherwise.

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent e)
      controls the direction the snake is facing
      Parameters:

    • setLength

      public void setLength(int length)
      set the length of the snake to a new length when the snake eat food.
      Parameters:
      length - is greater than the previous length

    • getLength

      public int getLength()
      Used to get the snake length.

      the length of the snake

    • resetSnake

      public void resetSnake()
      Resets the body points on the snake when the game ends.

    • move

      public void move(int level)
      Controls the movement of the snake on the view. Add or subtract from the xPosition or yPosition based on the direction of the snake.
      Specified by:
      move in interface Movable
      Parameters:
      level - is the level of the game. Level 1 has a different rule for moving
